Package Tools

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Tools.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The class Controller plays the simulation. The class contains all the information like Rulesets, environment and population. All steps are being updated from this class

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run(String filePath, int initPopulationSize, double[] initDistribution, int initPlaceInds, int initTumorsize, int numberTypes, double[][] payoffMatrix, double interactionRadius, double offspringRadius, double deathProbability, double carryingCapacity, int numberMigrationSites, double fractionInvasiveCells, double probToMigrate, double survivalDestination, String savePath, String fileName, int simulationRuns, int gap, int steps, int cancerTreatmentStep, double killingSensitive, int migrastaticsStep, double probToMigrateDuringTreatment, int ATadaptiveStep, double ATstartTreatment, double ATstopTreatment) throws IOException

      The Run function is the starting point for the simulation. It uses all the available parameters to start the simulation. It triggers a loop where all steps are executed and stores the results in the provided output location (parameter savePath).

      Parameters:
      filePath - The file that contains the configuration for the initial population.
      initPopulationSize - the initial population size provided through the GUI, these are the number of cells the simulation starts with.
      initDistribution - The initial distribution of cells that are sensitive or resistant.
      initPlaceInds - ? Place individuals?
      initTumorsize - The initial size of the tumor at the start of the simulation, defined as a radius.
      numberTypes - The number of cell types that are supported in the simulation.
      payoffMatrix - The interaction between the different cell types.
      interactionRadius - How far off from the radius of a cell interactions can take place.
      offspringRadius - How far off a cell can place its offspring.
      deathProbability - Probability of cell death for every iteration
      carryingCapacity - How many neighbours one cell can have.
      numberMigrationSites - Number of sites the primary tumor can metastasise to.
      fractionInvasiveCells - Fraction of cells that can metastatise.
      probToMigrate - Probability for one cell to migrate to a metastasise.
      survivalDestination - Probability for one cell to survive at new location
      savePath - Location on file system to store output of the simulation.
      fileName - Name of file given for storing the output of the simulation
      simulationRuns - How many times a simulation can be run chronologically
      gap - The configuration after the amount of steps that the output should be generated.
      steps - The number of steps each individual simulation should take.
      cancerTreatmentStep - At what step the cancer treatment should start in the simulation.
      killingSensitive - Percentage of sensitive cells that are killed at every step by the cancer treatment.
      migrastaticsStep - At what step the migrastatics treatment should start in the simulation
      probToMigrateDuringTreatment - The probability to migrate once migrastatics treatment is on.
      ATadaptiveStep - At what step the adaptive treatment should be started.
      ATstartTreatment - At what tumor size to start the treatment as a fraction of the initial tumor size
      ATstopTreatment - At what tumor size to stop the treatment as a fraction of the initial tumor size.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception thrown for any error.

    • performStep

      public void performStep(int currentStep, int steps) throws IOException

      The performStep function will execute an individual step of the simulation

      Parameters:
      currentStep - The index of the current step being executed.
      steps - The total number of steps to execute in this simulation.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exceptiont thrown for any error.
